description: I had some doubts that there might be some falls on this tributary.  The main West Bass River has a large one at approximately the same contour lies I decided to visit on a crisp March morning.the first stream I followed lost a lot of elevation but never achieved any large fall.  Once another tributary  met up with the one I was following there was a couple of nice 10-15 ft falls.  I decided to follow that second tributary upstream.  although it didn't show on my 1:50 000 topo it showed up on a 1:10000.   After a few nice small fall, I was rewarded with a huge fall.  I would say its a good 50ft plus.  However it might only flow strongly in spring or after rain events.
directions: Old economy Rd.  Turn right on dirt rd at N45 26 33.0 W63 47 30.2 and go up or walk up to the first stream crossing at N45 27 53.5 W63 47 40.7
title: West Bass River Tributary Fall
